00.orig_text: US stocks see 9% drop before making recovery
00.text: US stocks see 9% drop before making recovery

02.orig_text: US stock markets saw an unusually turbulent day yesterday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) losing almost a thousand points in thirty minutes, although later recovered somewhat to end the day with a smaller loss.
02.text: US stock markets saw an unusually turbulent day yesterday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) losing almost a thousand points in thirty minutes, although later recovered somewhat to end the day with a smaller loss.

03.orig_text: The DJIA had its worst fall since 1987, a drop of 9% or 998.50 points, before going back up a bit to close with a loss of 3.30% or 347.80 points to a level of 10,520.
03.text: The DJIA had its worst fall since 1987, a drop of 9% or 998.50 points, before going back up a bit to close with a loss of 3.30% or 347.80 points to a level of 10,520.

04.orig_text: The Nasdaq fell 82.65 points or 3.44%, and the Standard & Poor's 500 index dropped 3.24% or 37.75 points.
04.text: The Nasdaq fell 82.65 points or 3.44%, and the Standard & Poor's 500 index dropped 3.24% or 37.75 points.

05.orig_text: According to some reports, the quick loss happened because a trader mistyped an order to sell a large amount of stock, causing the stock price to go down enough to trigger orders to sell elsewhere in the market.
05.text: According to some reports, the quick loss happened because a trader mistyped an order to sell a large amount of stock, causing the stock price to go down enough to trigger orders to sell elsewhere in the market.

06.orig_text: (By the following day this theory had been abandoned.)
06.text: (By the following day this theory had been abandoned.)

07.orig_text: Other reports suggested that the biggest markets ``slowed`` their executions when it became clear that computerized errors were occurring; as a result, the vast majority of buy orders were briefly withdrawn, allowing the free-fall to continue for several minutes.
07.text: Other reports suggested that the biggest markets ``slowed`` their executions when it became clear that computerized errors were occurring; as a result, the vast majority of buy orders were briefly withdrawn, allowing the free-fall to continue for several minutes.

08.orig_text: Stock for the Procter & Gamble company fell almost 37% during the sell-off, about 75 minutes to the closing bell.
08.text: Stock for the Procter & Gamble company fell almost 37% during the sell-off, about 75 minutes to the closing bell.

09.orig_text: An investigation started into whether any erroneous trades happened.
09.text: An investigation started into whether any erroneous trades happened.

10.orig_text: Procter & Gamble spokeswoman Jennifer Chelune spoke about the incident: ``We don't know what caused it.
10.text: Procter & Gamble spokeswoman Jennifer Chelune spoke about the incident: ``We don't know what caused it.

11.orig_text: We know that that was an electronic trade [...] and we're looking into it with Nasdaq and the other major electronic exchanges.``
11.text: We know that that was an electronic trade [...] and we're looking into it with Nasdaq and the other major electronic exchanges.``

12.orig_text: The Reuters news agency reports that, at their height, the losses cause equity values to lose $1 trillion.
12.text: The Reuters news agency reports that, at their height, the losses cause equity values to lose $1 trillion.

13.orig_text: Some stocks saw extreme, but short, changes; for instance, consulting firm Accenture saw its shares plummet from about $42 to four cents, although it later rebounded to close the day at $41.09.
13.text: Some stocks saw extreme, but short, changes; for instance, consulting firm Accenture saw its shares plummet from about $42 to four cents, although it later rebounded to close the day at $41.09.

14.orig_text: Meanwhile, oil prices also dropped to lows not reached since February.
14.text: Meanwhile, oil prices also dropped to lows not reached since February.

15.orig_text: Benchmark crude was down $2.86 to $77.11 in New York.
15.text: Benchmark crude was down $2.86 to $77.11 in New York.

16.orig_text: ``The potential for giant high-speed computers to generate false trades and create market chaos reared its head again today,`` said Delaware senator Edward Kaufman.
16.text: ``The potential for giant high-speed computers to generate false trades and create market chaos reared its head again today,`` said Delaware senator Edward Kaufman.

17.orig_text: ``The battle of the algorithms -- not understood by nor even remotely transparent to the Securities and Exchange Commission -- simply must be carefully reviewed and placed within a meaningful regulatory framework soon.``
17.text: ``The battle of the algorithms -- not understood by nor even remotely transparent to the Securities and Exchange Commission -- simply must be carefully reviewed and placed within a meaningful regulatory framework soon.``

18.orig_text: Kaufman, along with senator Mark Warner from Virginia, called on Congress to investigate the cause of the mass sell-offs.
18.text: Kaufman, along with senator Mark Warner from Virginia, called on Congress to investigate the cause of the mass sell-offs.

19.orig_text: Nasdaq, meanwhile, says that all trades of stocks at prices 60% higher or lower than the preceding price at or around 2.40 PM ``or immediately prior`` are to be cancelled; it noted that it coordinated its move with the other exchanges.
19.text: Nasdaq, meanwhile, says that all trades of stocks at prices 60% higher or lower than the preceding price at or around 2.40 PM ``or immediately prior`` are to be cancelled; it noted that it coordinated its move with the other exchanges.

20.orig_text: Chief investment officer at Fort Pitt Capital Group Charlie Smith said: ``I think the machines just took over.
20.text: Chief investment officer at Fort Pitt Capital Group Charlie Smith said: ``I think the machines just took over.

21.orig_text: There's not a lot of human interaction.
21.text: There's not a lot of human interaction.

22.orig_text: We've known that automated trading can run away from you, and I think that's what we saw happen today.``
22.text: We've known that automated trading can run away from you, and I think that's what we saw happen today.``

23.orig_text: In the past three days, the DJIA has lost 631 points, or 5.7%, mainly over concerns about Greece's ailing, debt-burdened economy.
23.text: In the past three days, the DJIA has lost 631 points, or 5.7%, mainly over concerns about Greece's ailing, debt-burdened economy.

24.orig_text: Peter Boockvar an equity strategist for Miller Tabak, commented: ``The market is now realizing that Greece is going to go through a depression over the next couple of years.
24.text: Peter Boockvar an equity strategist for Miller Tabak, commented: ``The market is now realizing that Greece is going to go through a depression over the next couple of years.

25.orig_text: Europe is a major trading partner of ours, and this threatens the entire global growth story.``
25.text: Europe is a major trading partner of ours, and this threatens the entire global growth story.``
